ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and laugh and do not cry,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And keep laughing and do not weep,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Will you laugh at it rather than weep?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and do they laugh instead of weeping,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And you laugh, and do not weep!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you laugh at it and weep not,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And will you laugh and not weep?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and do you laugh, and do you not weep,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Why do you laugh rather than weep?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And will ye laugh and not weep,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And you laugh at it and weep not,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Or do you laugh, and do you not weep
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And laugh, and do not weep?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And you laugh and do not weep
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:60] and laugh, mockingly, and not weep, when you hear its Promise and Threat,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And laugh) at out of derision (and not weep) because of what it contains of rebuke, threats and warning,
